    Golden Ratio

    Concepts

    Golden Ratio For Calculating Sizes of Website Regions

    What is Golden Ratio?

      The golden ratio is the ratio of 1 to 1.6180334. This ratio appears very often in nature and is seen to be beautiful and pleasing to the human eye.

    Calculation

      The Golden Ratio is known for the proportion 1:1.618.The scientific condition at work isn't as simple as just getting the ratio, but this is the base for the creation and calculation used to get the Golden Ratio on a Webpage.

    Square Root for Margins / Padding

    How Do You Use Square Root Method in CSS?

      Start off with taking the width of the screen in pixels. Square root it and then continue to double what you got from the square root. Subtract your answer from the width and that will be your Golden Ratio. Use that mathematical answer in your CSS values and properties.

    How to make an F Layout in Code

    What is an F Layout?

      The F-Layout in a website was created in the midst of eyetracking studies done to see where people looked the most. These scientific studies show that people who use websites read the screen in an "F" pattern

    How do you create an F Layout?

      When it comes to creating an F layout in code, there are three elements that make the layout successful

    1. A page that includes text that has little or no formatting for the web. For example, it has a “wall of text” but no bolding, bullets, or subheadings.

    2. Who ever is reading it wants to be efficient on the page.

    3. The reader isn't interested in reading every word, so have pictures.

    In your Code, there should be a few key things

    1. They will likely be attracted to the page headline first, since the font is bigger and a portion of it is bold.

    2. Next, they will move along the first stem to the image on the right which will make the first stem of the F

    3. Scanning down the vertical stem, viewers will read a subheadline.

    4. Continuing down, A picture will most likely attract them

    5. After the picture, footers, or additional tags will be viewable
